reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Envelope 1: Enhance access to life-saving, integrated emergency obstetric and newborn health and GBV services to IDP and host communities in Jandairis-Afrin district in northwest Syria.

description.narrative:
SRD is proposing to enhance access to lifesaving, integrated health services through the provision of secondary reproductive and child healthcare to vulnerable populations, particularly women and children for a period 10 months. These services will be provided through existing Comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Newborn Care (CEmONC) facility currently operated by SRD. This includes Jandairis Comprehensive EmONC Hospital in the Jandairis-Afrin area. These essential, emergency health interventions are critical for reducing and preventing maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality. A series of clinical trainings will be delivered to staff throughout the life of the project in order to build and strengthen capacity of service providers. As part of SRD's current model of integrating sexual and reproductive health (SRH) and gender-based violence (GBV) services, SRD will ensure safe access to appropriate and specialized health services and case management for women and children who have experienced GBV. the hospital consists of total 34 beds + 2 labor rooms + 2 operations rooms as detailed in the following departments: Pediatrics: 16 beds = 12 in-patients beds, 2 ICU beds, 1 ICU incubator, 1 isolation bed. Incubation: 9 incubators + 1 photo-therapy device. RH: 6 inpatients beds Labor: 2 labor rooms Operations: 2 fully equipped operations rooms Emergency: 2 beds
Jendaris Maternity and child Hospital will provide all 9 CEmONC services 24 / 7 including: 1. Parenteral administration of Antibiotics 2. Treatments for eclampsia (provision of anticonvulsants) 3. Parenteral administration of Oxytocics 4. Assisted Vaginal delivery (vacuum extraction) 5. Manual removal of Placenta 6.Removal of retained products 7. Newborn resuscitation 8. blood transfusion 9. Surgeries and C/S
The hospital is operative during the last 2 year. The monthly average services provided for the indicators and targets in the last year is the baseline considers to calculate the total targeted services. The OPD consultation monthly average is 4800 consultations, the ANC services average services provided is 1091 ANC services.
